A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Damn shame what they did to this movie - fine with creative choices when they take the story forward with respect to what went before it - this one failed to do the latter. It seems Darth Mouse is so pre-occupied with creating twists and mysteries that can keep the fans speculating for two years\, while paying no attention to telling a good story. Got no problem with the Snoke theories being all kinds of wrong\, but sending the most iconic sci-fi hero out this way just breaks my heart. Fans have kept this franchise alive since 1977\, not studios - the character development that this movie took\, is just taking a big piss on fans and a legacy that Disney had no hand in building.
